oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter written to Julia White by James F. M. Lewis, Co. F, 13th Tenn. Cav. Regt., USA
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The letter, wrtitten from the field, tells Julia of the death by a "vicious mob" of her husband, James White, near Marion, Va. The 13th Tenn. Cav. Regt., USA took part in the battle of Marion December 17-18, 1864. The battle resulted in a Confederate withdrawal and the loss of the saltworks at Saltville, Va. The last part of the letter mentions Daniel Ellis. Ellis was a noted "pilot" who guided Union men in East Tenn. to recruiting stations in Kentucky in order to join the Union army.
